description:
Alprazolam 0.5 mg, an orange, round pill identified by imprint R 029, is manufactured by Actavis. It is a benzodiazepine used to treat anxiety and panic disorder, classified as a Schedule 4 controlled substance. Pregnancy may pose risks to fetuses.

Major interactions include Norco, while moderate interactions involve medications like Ambien and Cymbalta. Common side effects encompass changes in appetite, sexual functions, and menstrual cycles, with less common effects including skin irritation and double vision. Rare side effects can involve severe skin reactions and visual disturbances.

major interactions.Norco (acetaminophen / hydrocodone): Norco is a pain relief medicine that combines acetaminophen and hydrocodone.

More common side effects: absent, missed, or irregular menstrual periods
decreased sexual performance or desire abnormal ejaculation
inability to have or keep an erection
increased in sexual ability, desire, drive, or performance
loss in sexual ability, desire, drive, or performance
Less common side effects: blistering, crusting, irritation, itching, or reddening of the skin
change in taste bad unusual or unpleasant (after) taste
redness of the face, neck, arms, and occasionally, upper chest
Rare side effects: bigger, dilated, or enlarged pupils (black part of eye)
feeling of constant movement of self or surroundings
increased sensitivity of eyes to sunlight
Incidence not known: blistering, peeling, or loosening of the skin
red skin lesions, often with a purple center
sores, ulcers, or white spots in the mouth or on the lips
swelling of the breasts or breast soreness in both females and males
unexpected or excess milk flow from breasts
